title: Lewis Hamilton ends Mercedes test early after electrical fault sidelines him on final day in Barcelona
text:

Lewis Hamilton's first F1 test of the year has ended prematurely after an electrical fault with his Mercedes prevented him from taking to the circuit on Thursday. 
The triple world champion announced on Twitter that he wouldn't drive the car on the final day of the first pre-season test session in Barcelona. 
Despite the setback, Mercedes' first major reliability concern with their 2017 challenger, Hamilton remained positive having racked up more than 200 laps over the three previous days and setting competitive times. 
"Electrical fault kept us in the garage this morning, so I've decided with the team not to drive today as I wouldn't have learned much," tweeted the 32-year-old. Read More All Formula 1 teams' new cars revealed ahead of Australian Grand Prix next month 
"Shame not to drive but it's been a great few days. The guys have done an awesome job. Can't wait to be back in the car next week!" 
Both Hamilton and new teammate Valtteri Bottas have been chalking up the miles on their new W08 since its launch at Silverstone in February.
